rubenchristoffer.hetty

Class HTTPCookie

  • java.lang.Object
    • rubenchristoffer.hetty.HTTPCookie
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HTTPValidatedCookie

    public class HTTPCookie
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for representing HTTP cookie.
    Author:
    Ruben Christoffer
    See Also:
    https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPCookie

        public HTTPCookie(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String value,
                  HTTPCookieAttribute... attributes)
        Creates a new HTTPCookie.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the cookie
        value - is the value of the cookie. Will be converted to empty string if null
        attributes - is the attributes of the cookie. Can be empty array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name or attributes is null

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name.
        Returns:
        the name of the cookie

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Gets the value.
        Returns:
        the value of the cookie

      • getAttributes

        public HTTPCookieAttribute[] getAttributes()
        Gets attributes.
        Returns:
        the HTTPCookieAttributes as array

      • getAttribute

        public HTTPCookieAttribute getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Gets attribute based on name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the attribute
        Returns:
        the attribute if found, null otherwise

      • containsAttribute

        public boolean containsAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Does the cookie contain this attribute?
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the attribute
        Returns:
        true if attribute was found, false otherwise

      • generateCookie

        public java.lang.String generateCookie()
        Generates the cookie string based on name, value and potential attributes. This is the opposite of HTTPParser.parseCookie(String)
        Returns:
        the string representation of this cookie
